item.title: How Republics provide for their Safety
item.description: A small republic is destroyed by a foreign force. A large one is ruined by an internal imperfection. Democracies and aristocracies are equally liable to these. This is why mankind has been obliged to live constantly under the government of a single person until they developed a confederate republic. Such a constitution has: all the internal advantages of a republican government the external force of a monarchical government A confederate republic is a convention by which petty states agree to become members of a larger one, which they intend to establish.

item.title: How Republics provide for their Safety
item.description: Chapter 4: How Despotic Governments provide for their Security Republics provide for their security by uniting. Despotic governments do it by separating, and by keeping themselves single. They sacrifice a part of the country; and, by rav aging and desolating the frontiers, they render the heart of the empire inaccessible. This practice is more tolerable in large than in middling states. A despotic government does all the mischief to itself that could be committed by a strong, cruel enemy.
